channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14524] Short-circuit comparison of rows in CellComparator
item.description:
CellComparator#compareRows compares two rows. For Scans and Gets these objects can sometimes be exactly the same object.

I see this (without fully understanding everything that's going on) for the first cell in each row.

In these circumstances I think it makes sense to short-circuit the comparison (not do a byte comparison and class cast checks) and bail out early if the objects are identical.
item.summary: Short-circuit comparison of rows in CellComparator

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

There are no failed unit tests... and I didn't include another test because I forgot. I will add another patch with a new test that'll check whether same cells are always returning 0.

Thanks for filing Lars F. I was checking what all short circuit we miss in BBUtils compare/equals methods compared to that in Bytes.java.
You got any chance for test the gain this short circuit gives us?

Makes sense Lars Francke

This is what failed....TestBoundedByteBufferPool it hung.... does it hang locally for you? I think I've seen it fail elsewhere recently... so may not be you.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15877//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15877//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15877//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15877//console

This message is automatically generated.

For Scans and Gets these objects can sometimes be exactly the same object.

It will be great if u can analyze it and say how often we do this. Who is calling it. Then we can see why that really happens.
In that case whether call to equals methods in CellUtil also happens same with Cells?
Lars Francke Any analysis results as per above 2 comments.

Anoop Sam John I didn't get around to it and it can be another few weeks or months, I'm swamped at the moment. Found this when debugging the read path for a customer and was surprised that for every new row those two values are the same. I have it on my radar though and will update here when I get around to it.

Thanks.. Let me try it out once then.

for every new row those two values are the same

That will be too many of compare calls overall with same Cells.

Checked this. Yes at begin of row we do this.
In StoreScanner#next(List<Cell> outResult, ScannerContext scannerContext), we set the cur cell as the new row to SQM.
And after this there is a loop to fetch cells for the row and in that every cell is being matched by SQM. In that flow, for the 1st cell, it will get compared against itself.
In Bytes.java there is a short circuit for this. BBUtils compare method missed that.
By adding this object == check, we can avoid unwanted bytes compare (all bytes of rows) and type checks.

+1. We can get this in.
Rebase for trunk

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-Trunk_matrix #610 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/610/)
HBASE-14524 Short-circuit comparison of rows in CellComparator. (Lars (anoopsamjohn: rev 9997e4ee52136a681faa825dea46bd1162d71eca)

  • hbase-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/CellComparator.java
Anoop Sam John Thanks a lot for checking up on this, reviewing and committing!

in hbase 0.98.10, CellComparator is used to compact two cell, row,family and so on
similarly, we can add Short-circuit comparison in class CellComparator of hbase 0.98.10
